Name: A Living Death
Text: Place this dilemma on this mission. Each personnel on this planet who does not have Treachery is attributes -1. At the end of this turn, this dilemma is overcome.

Name: Aggressive Behavior
Text: Unless you have 2 Anthropology or 2 Leadership and Weapons>8, randomly select a personnel to be killed, all your other personnel are stopped, and this dilemma is placed on your ship. Damage - This ship is attributes -2.

Name: Alien Abduction
Text: Unless you have 2 Engineer and Physics or Medical and Transporters, randomly select three personnel to be stopped.

Name: Antedean Assassins
Text: Unless you have a personnel who has 2 Anthropology or a personnel who has 2 Telepathy, your opponent chooses an Anthropology or Telepathy personnel to be stopped. If your opponent cannot, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Armus Roulette
Text: Randomly select four personnel. Unless they have Cunning>22 or one of them has Cunning>7, your opponent chooses one of them to be killed, then the other three are stopped.

Name: Assassin's Blade
Text: Unless you have 2 Security or Cunning>26, your opponent chooses a personnel (except an Android or a Shape-shifter) to be killed, then all your other personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Assassination Attempt
Text: Randomly select two personnel. Each of those personnel who does not have Treachery is killed.

Name: Authenticate Artifacts
Text: Unless you have a personnel who has 2 Anthropology or a personnel who has 2 Archaeology, your opponent chooses an Anthropology or Archaeology personnel to be stopped. If your opponent cannot, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Automated Weapons
Text: Unless you have 2 Security or a Hand Weapon, randomly select a personnel to be killed, then all your other personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Berserk Changeling
Text: Unless you have 2 Exobiology and 2 Science or 3 Security or two Hand Weapons, randomly select a personnel (except a Changeling) to be killed, then all your other personnel are stopped.

Name: Blended
Text: Unless you have Diplomacy or Telepathy, all your personnel are stopped. If you have two or more personnel who have Diplomacy or Telepathy, randomly select all but one of those personnel to be stopped.

Name: Center of Attention
Text: Unless you have 3 Security or a Hand Weapon and Cunning>28 or {Quark}, your opponent chooses a Treachery personnel to be killed, then all your other personnel are stopped.

Name: Chula: Echoes
Text: Randomly select three personnel. If the highest Cunning among those personnel is even, all three of them are stopped.

Name: Chula: Pick One to Save Two
Text: Randomly select three personnel. Choose to return one of those personnel to its owner's hand or to have all three of them be stopped.

Name: Command Decisions
Text: Choose a personnel who has Leadership or Officer to be stopped. If you cannot, randomly select a personnel to be killed.

Name: Console Overload
Text: Unless you have 2 Engineer or 2 Programming, choose a personnel who has Medical or Science to be stopped, then this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Contamination
Text: Unless you have Engineer and Physics or 2 Exobiology, all your Medical personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Damaged Reputation
Text: If you have Integrity>50, lose 5 points. Also, unless you have 2 Diplomacy or Intelligence and 2 Treachery or Strength>30, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Dangerous Liaisons
Text: Unless you have 2 Science and 2 Security or 3 Treachery, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Debris Field
Text: Unless you have Astrometrics or Navigation, all your Engineer personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Drumhead
Text: Unless you have Law, randomly select a personnel who has Integrity<4 to be placed in its owner's discard pile. If you cannot, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Enemy Boarding Party
Text: Randomly select three personnel. Each of those personnel who has Strength<6 is killed.

Name: Equipment Malfunction
Text: Return all your equipment to their owner's hands.

Name: Explosive Decompression
Text: Randomly select a personnel to be killed. If you still have nine personnel remaining, randomly select a second personnel to be killed. If you still have ten personnel remaining, randomly select a third personnel to be killed.

Name: Gravimetric Distortion
Text: Unless you have 2 Astrometrics or 3 Engineer or a personnel who has 2 Navigation, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma is placed on your ship. Damage - This ship is attributes -2.

Name: Graviton Ellipse
Text: Unless you have Astrometrics, Engineer, and Physics or Shields + unused Range this turn>13, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma is placed on your ship. Damage - This ship is attributes -2.

Name: Hunter Gangs
Text: Randomly select two personnel. Each of those personnel who has Cunning+Strength<11 is killed.

Name: Impressive Trophies
Text: Unless you have Cunning>32, your personnel who has the highest cost is placed in your opponent's brig, then all your other personnel are stopped.

Name: Invidium Leak
Text: Unless you have Engineer and 2 Programming or 2 Medical, all your personnel are stopped.

Name: Kelvan Show of Force
Text: Your opponent chooses two personnel (except an Android or a Hologram). Randomly select one of those personnel to be killed.

Name: Kolaran Raiders
Text: Choose a personnel who has Leadership or Security to be stopped. If you cannot, randomly select a personnel to be killed.

Name: Limited Welcome
Text: Randomly select nine personnel. All your other personnel are stopped. Place this dilemma on this mission. When you attempt this mission again, after your opponent draws dilemmas, he or she may take this dilemma and add it to those drawn.

Name: Maglock
Text: Unless you have 3 Officer or 3 Programming, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Magnetic Field Disruptions
Text: Choose a personnel who has Astrometrics or Navigation to be stopped. If you cannot, randomly select a personnel to be killed.

Name: Microbrain
Text: Unless you have a personnel who has 2 Exobiology or a personnel who has 2 Geology, your opponent chooses an Exobiology or Geology personnel to be stopped. If your opponent cannot, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Misguided Activist
Text: Randomly select a [Cmd] personnel to be stopped. Unless you have Diplomacy and 2 Honor or 2 Security or {Miles O'Brien}, that personnel is killed instead.

Name: Nanite Attack
Text: Unless you have 2 Diplomacy and 2 Engineer or 2 Security and a Hand Weapon, this dilemma is placed on your ship. Damage - At the end of each of your turns, randomly select a personnel aboard this ship to be killed.

Name: None Shall Pass
Text: Unless you have 2 Anthropology or 3 Diplomacy or Strength>35, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Ornaran Threat
Text: Randomly select a personnel to be stopped. Unless you have Diplomacy and Medical or 2 Security, that personnel is killed instead, then all your other personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Personal Duty
Text: Unless you have Leadership or Officer, all your personnel are stopped. If you have two or more personnel who have Leadership or Officer, randomly select all but one of those personnel to be stopped.

Name: Pinned Down
Text: Randomly select a personnel to be stopped. If you still have nine personnel remaining, randomly select a second personnel to be stopped. If you still have ten personnel remaining, randomly select a third personnel to be stopped.

Name: Planetary Survey
Text: Choose a personnel who has Geology or Programming to be stopped. If you cannot, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Primitive Culture
Text: Unless you have Anthropology and Leadership or 3 Diplomacy or 2 Intelligence or four personnel who each have Strength>6, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Pursuit Just Behind
Text: Randomly select a personnel to be killed. If you still have nine personnel remaining, randomly select a second personnel to be killed. If you still have ten personnel remaining, randomly select a third personnel to be killed.

Name: Quarren Labor Shortage
Text: Unless at least half your personnel are not [NA], all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Recurring Injury
Text: Unless you have a personnel who has 2 Biology or a personnel who has 2 Medical, your opponent chooses an Biology or Medical personnel to be stopped. If your opponent cannot, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Skullduggery
Text: Randomly select a personnel. If that personnel has Acquisition or Treachery, he or she is stopped. Otherwise, he or she is killed.

Name: Stellar Core Fragment
Text: Unless you have a personnel who has 2 Physics or a personnel who has 2 Science, your opponent chooses an Physics or Science personnel to be stopped. If your opponent cannot, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Sympathetic Magic
Text: Unless you choose to place this dilemma on your ship at this mission, all your personnel are stopped. Damage - This ship is attributes-2.

Name: Systems Diagnostic
Text: Choose a personnel who has Engineer or Programming to be stopped. If you cannot, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Temptation
Text: Randomly select three personnel. Each of those personnel that does not have Honor or Treachery is stopped.

Name: Tense Negotiations
Text: Unless you have a personnel who has 2 Diplomacy or a personnel who has 2 Leadership, your opponent chooses an Diplomacy or Leadership personnel to be stopped. If your opponent cannot, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Trabe Grenade
Text: Randomly select a personnel who has Leadership or Security. If that personnel has Cunning<7, he or she is killed.

Name: Triage
Text: Choose a personnel who has Biology or Medical to be stopped. If you cannot, randomly select a personnel to be killed.

Name: Unscientific Method
Text: The most Cunning Science personnel who does not have Treachery is killed. Unless you have Cunning>24 remaining, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Vastly Outnumbered
Text: If you have Strength>55, lose 5 points. Also, unless you have Anthropology and 2 Honor or two Hand Weapons or Integrity>28, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Wavefront
Text: Unless you have a personnel who has 2 Astrometrics or a personnel who has 2 Navigation, your opponent chooses an Astrometrics or Navigation personnel to be stopped. If your opponent cannot, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: A Klingon Matter
Text: Unless you have 2 Intelligence and Treachery or 2 Leadership and Cunning>32, randomly select a personnel. If that personnel has Strength<7, he or she is killed, then all your other personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Casualties of War
Text: Randomly select three personnel. If the total cost of those personnel is 4 or less, they are killed. Otherwise, randomly select one of those personnel to be killed.

Name: Crippling Attack
Text: Unless you have 2 Leadership and Officer or 2 Navigation and Shields>6, randomly select a personnel to be killed, then this dilemma is placed on your ship. Damage - This ship is attributes -2.

Name: Dedication to Duty
Text: Randomly select a personnel. Unless you choose to kill that personnel, your opponent draws a number of cards equal to the number of [SD] icons on that personnel.

Name: Disgraceful Assault
Text: Unless you have 2 Security and Transporters, randomly select a personnel to be stopped. Unless you have Biology and 2 Medical, that personnel is killed instead, then all your personnel are stopped.

Name: Disruptor Accident
Text: Randomly select a personnel. Unless you choose to kill that personnel, he or she and a second randomly selected personnel are stopped.

Name: DNA Security Scan
Text: Unless you have Engineer and 2 Programming or 2 Security and Cunning>36, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Exposed Power Relay
Text: Randomly select a personnel to be stopped. If you still have nine personnel remaining, that personnel is killed instead, then randomly select a second personnel to be killed. If you still have ten personnel remaining, your opponent chooses a third personnel to be killed.

Name: Face to Face
Text: Your opponent names a skill. Randomly select two personnel. Each of those personnel that has that skill is killed.

Name: Flim-Flam Artist
Text: Unless you have Diplomacy and 2 Programming or Law and Cunning>32, all your personnel are stopped, your opponent may draw a card, and this dilemma is returned to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Head to Head
Text: Your opponent names a skill. Randomly select two personnel. Each of those personnel that has that skill is killed.

Name: Hired Muscle
Text: Unless you have 2 Acquisition or choose to discard three cards from hand, your opponent chooses a [NA] personnel to be placed on top of his owner's deck.

Name: Houdini Mines
Text: Unless you have 2 Engineer and 2 Science or 2 Programming and 3 Security, randomly select a personnel to be killed, then this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Meaningless Words
Text: Unless you choose to discard the top three cards of your deck, your opponent chooses a personnel to be stopped.

Name: Memory Invasion
Text: Your opponent examines your hand and chooses a card. Unless you choose to discard that card, randomly select three personnel to be stopped.

Name: Nausicaan Pirates
Text: Unless you have Leadership and 2 Security or 2 Treachery and Strength>35, randomly select a personnel to be killed, then all your other personnel are stopped.

Name: Picking Up the Pieces
Text: Unless you have Geology or Programming, all your personnel are stopped. If you have two or more personnel who have Geology or Programming, randomly select all but one of those personnel to be stopped.

Name: Plasma Shock
Text: Randomly select a personnel. If that personnel has Strength>6, he or she is stopped. Otherwise, he or she is killed.

Name: Quaint Technology
Text: Unless you have 2 Anthropology and Programming or 2 Diplomacy and Cunning>34, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Racial Tension
Text: Randomly select two personnel. Unless they are the same species, both are stopped.

Name: Sorting Things Out
Text: If a personnel has been killed during this mission attempt, randomly select a personnel to be stopped.

Name: Stolen Computer Core
Text: Unless you have Intelligence and Transporters or 2 Security and Cunning>34, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma is placed on your ship. Damage - While a Programming personnel is aboard this ship, his or her owners must discard a card from hand to use that programming.

Name: Subspace Accident
Text: Unless you have Astrometrics and 2 Navigation or 2 Physics and Science, randomly select a personnel to be placed on the bottom of his or her owner's deck.

Name: Telepathic Deception
Text: Unless you have Biology, Exobiology, and Security or Telepathy and Cunning>28, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Timescape
Text: Place this dilemma on this mission. You cannot begin a mission attempt at this mission. At the end of this turn, this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Training Accident
Text: Randomly select three personnel. If the total cost of those personnel is 4 or less, they are killed. Otherwise, randomly select one of those personnel to be killed.

Name: Traitor Exposed
Text: Randomly select a Treachery personnel. If that personnel has Cunning>6, he or she is stopped. Otherwise, he or she is killed.

Name: Unexpected
Text: Randomly select a personnel to be stopped. Unless you have Astrometrics and 2 Diplomacy or Exobiology and 2 Medical, place that personnel on top of his or her owner's deck instead.

Name: A Bad End
Text: Randomly select one of your stopped personnel on this planet to be killed.

Name: An Old Debt
Text: Unless you have Biology, Physics, and Cunning>32 or Intelligence and 2 Medical, randomly select a Leadership personnel to be killed.

Name: Close Call
Text: Unless you have 2 Diplomacy and Security or 2 Programming and Transporters, randomly select an Engineer to be killed.

Name: Confined to Quarters
Text: Randomly select three personnel. If any of those personnel has Leadership, all three are stopped. Otherwise, choose one of those personnel to be stopped.

Name: Dangerous Climb
Text: Unless you have 2 Geology or Strength>40, randomly select a personnel to be killed, then all your other personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Depression
Text: Unless you have 2 Anthropology or 2 Medical or Telepathy and Integrity>32, your opponent chooses a personnel to be stopped and this dilemma is returned to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: DNA Analysis
Text: Unless you have a personnel who has 2 Medical or a personnel who has 2 Science, your opponent chooses a Medical or Science personnel to be stopped. If your opponent cannot, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Dressing Down
Text: Randomly select three personnel. If the cost of any of those personnel is 1, all three are stopped. Otherwise, choose one of those personnel to be stopped.

Name: Failure To Communicate
Text: Unless you have a personnel who has 2 Anthropology or a personnel who has 2 Security, your opponent chooses a Anthropology or Security personnel to be stopped. If your opponent cannot, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Forsaken
Text: Unless you have 2 Honor or 2 Treachery, all your personnel are stopped. Each Honor or Treachery personnel that uses his or her skills while facing this dilemma is placed on the bottom of his or her owner's deck.

Name: Gomtuu Shock Wave
Text: Unless you have 2 Diplomacy and Integrity>32 or Telepathy and Integrity>35, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma is placed on your ship. Damage - This ship is attributes-2.

Name: Graviton Wave
Text: Unless you have Astrometrics, Physics, and Cunning>32 or Biology and 2 Medical, randomly select a Science personnel to be killed.

Name: History Repeats Itself
Text: Randomly select three personnel. If any of those personnel has Anthropology, all three are stopped. Otherwise, choose one of those personnel to be stopped.

Name: Inside Collaborators
Text: Unless you have a personnel who has 2 Diplomacy or a personnel who has 2 Treachery, your opponent chooses a Diplomacy or Treachery personnel to be stopped. If your opponent cannot, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Justice or Vengeance
Text: Unless you have Anthropology and 2 Security or Exobiology, Honor, and Integrity>32, randomly select a Treachery personnel to be killed.

Name: Miner Disagreement
Text: Unless you have Anthropology, Diplomacy, and Cunning>32 or 2 Exobiology and Leadership, randomly select a personnel to be stopped, then this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Murder Investigation
Text: Randomly select three personnel. If any of those personnel has Security, all three are stopped. Otherwise, randomly select one of those personnel to be stopped.

Name: Overwhelmed
Text: Place this dilemma on this mission. When a personnel facing a dilemma at this mission uses his or her skills, he or she is stopped. At the end of this turn, return this dilemma to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Psychic Receptacle
Text: Your opponent names a skill. Randomly select a personnel who has that skill. While a personnel who has that same card title is facing a dilemma, he or she cannot use his or her skills. This effect lasts until the end of this mission attempt.

Name: Psycho-Kinetic Attack
Text: Unless you have Exobiology and 2 Medical or Honor and Telepathy, randomly select a Security personnel to be killed.

Name: Quantum Filament
Text: Unless you have 2 Astrometrics and 2 Navigation or 2 Engineer, Science, and Shields>8, this dilemma is placed on your ship. Damage - When your personnel aboard this ship are about to face a dilemma, randomly select one of them to be stopped.

Name: Restricted Area
Text: Randomly select a personnel to be stopped. If you still have nine personnel remaining, that personnel is placed in your opponent's brig instead, then randomly select a second personnel to be placed in your opponent's brig. If you still have ten personnel remaining, randomly select a third personnel to be placed in your opponent's brig.

Name: Rock People
Text: Unless you have 2 Anthropology and Integrity>30 or Exobiology, Medical, and Cunning>35, randomly select a personnel to be killed, then all your other personnel are stopped.

Name: Rogue Borg Ambush
Text: Unless you have Intelligence and Cunning>35 or a Hand Weapon and Strength>35, randomly select a personnel to be killed, then all your other personnel are stopped.

Name: Secret Identity
Text: Your opponent chooses a personnel. You may replace him or her with any one personnel of the same affiliation from your deck. Place the personnel your opponent chose in his or her owner's discard pile. Shuffle and replace your deck.

Name: Sheer Lunacy
Text: Unless you have 2 Anthropology and Cunning>32 or 2 Programming and Science, randomly select a personnel to be stopped, then this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Skeleton Crew
Text: Place this dilemma on this mission. To begin a mission attempt at this mission, you must have at least six personnel involved. When you complete this mission, this dilemma is overcome.

Name: So Many Enemies
Text: Randomly select three personnel. If any of those personnel has Treachery, all three are stopped. Otherwise, randomly select one of those personnel to be stopped.

Name: Sokath, His Eyes Uncovered!
Text: Unless you have 2 Diplomacy or Cunning>35, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: The Demands of Duty
Text: Your opponent chooses a personnel. Unless you choose to have all your personnel be stopped, that personnel is killed.

Name: A Devil Scorned
Text: Unless you have 2 Diplomacy, 2 Treachery, and Cunning>42 or 2 Engineer, Navigation, and 2 Physics, randomly select a Leadership personnel to be stopped, then this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: A Pleasant Surprise
Text: Randomly select a Diplomacy or Treachery personnel to be stopped.

Name: A Royal Hunt
Text: For each of your headquarters missions, randomly select a personnel to be stopped. If you still have nine personnel remaining, randomly select another personnel to be stopped. This dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Alluring Spy
Text: Unless you have Diplomacy, 2 Exobiology, and Strength>42 or Intelligence, 2 Leadership, and Cunning>38, randomly select a Security personnel to be stopped, then this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Back Room Dealings
Text: Choose a personnel who has Treachery or Integrity<4 to be stopped. If you cannot, randomly select a personnel to be killed.

Name: Biochemical Hyperacceleration
Text: Randomly select three personnel. They cannot use their skills while facing this dilemma. Unless you have Biology, Geology, and Medical or 2 Security and Strength>38, those personnel are returned to their owner's hand.

Name: Bleeding to Death
Text: Unless you have Biology and 2 Medical or 2 Honor and Integrity>30, randomly select a personnel to be killed, then place this dilemma in your core. At the start of each of your turns, place the top card of your deck on this dilemma. When you complete a mission, all your cards here are shuffled and placed on top of your deck, then this dilemma is removed from the game.

Name: Broken Captive
Text: Your opponent chooses one of his or her captives. Unless you have the skills on that captive, all your personnel are stopped.

Name: Cave-In
Text: Unless you have 2 Engineer and Transporters or Geology, Officer, and Strength>35, randomly select two personnel to return to their owner's hand.

Name: Counterinsurgency Program
Text: Your opponent discards any number of event or equipment cards from hand and names a skill (except Acquisition, Intelligence, Law or Telepathy) for each one. Unless you have those skills, all your personnel are stopped.

Name: Dealing With Pressure
Text: Randomly select three personnel. Unless one of those personnel has an attribute>6, all three are stopped.

Name: Echo Papa Stasis Field
Text: Randomly select an Officer or Security personnel to be stopped.

Name: Formal Hearing
Text: For each event your opponent commands in his or her core, this dilemma is cost -1. Unless you have Diplomacy, Intelligence, 2 Programming and Cunning>38 or 2 Honor, Law, and 2 Officer, randomly select three personnel to be stopped.

Name: Harsh Conditions
Text: For each headquarters mission you command, your opponent names a skill. Place this dilemma on this mission. While your personnel is facing a dilemma, he or she cannot use those skills. At the end of this mission attempt, this dilemma is overcome.

Name: In the Way
Text: Randomly select a personnel. If that personnel has a skill listed in this mission's requirements (or any alternate requirements listed in the game text you are using to attempt it), he or she is stopped.

Name: In Training
Text: Randomly select a personnel who costs 1 or 2. All other personnel who cost 1 or 2 are stopped.

Name: Lack of Preparation
Text: Unless you have the skills needed to complete this mission, this dilemma and all remaining dilemmas you have not yet faced return to their owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Language Barrier
Text: Unless you have Anthropology and Leadership or 2 Diplomacy and Integrity>30, randomly stop two personnel for each headquarters mission you command.

Name: On Foreign Ground
Text: Unless you command an event in your core, your opponent chooses a personnel to be killed for each headquarters mission you command. If you have at least one card in your hand, you may discard your hand to prevent this.

Name: Renegade Ambush
Text: If your opponent commands a Jem'Hadar, randomly select a personnel to be killed. Otherwise, choose a personnel to be killed.

Name: Short Circuit
Text: Unless you have Engineer and 2 Physics or 2 Programming and Science, all of your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Side by Side
Text: Your opponent names a skill. Randomly select two personnel. Each of those personnel that has that skill is stopped.

Name: Talosian Trial
Text: Your opponent takes one of his or her planet dilemmas that is overcome beneath one of your missions and places it face down on top of his or her stack of chosen dilemmas.

Name: Test of Wisdom
Text: Unless you have Anthropology, 2 Archaeology, and Integrity>38 or 2 Honor and 2 Officer, all your Treachery personnel are stopped.

Name: The Dreamer and the Dream
Text: Place this dilemma on this mission. At the end of this turn, this dilemma is overcome. If at that time this mission has not been completed, its owner discards his or her hand.

Name: Tsiolkovsky Infection
Text: For each event your opponent commands in his or her core, this dilemma is cost -1. Unless you have 2 Anthropology, 2 Programming, and Cunning>38 or 2 Biology, Exobiology, and 2 Medical, randomly select three personnel to be killed.

Name: Ungracious Hosts
Text: Choose a personnel. Your opponent may discard cards from hand equal to the number of [SD] icons on that personnel to place him or her in your opponent's brig.

Name: Whisper in the Dark
Text: For each event your opponent commands in his or her core, this dilemma is cost -1. Unless you have 2 Geology, 2 Physics, and Cunning>38 or 2 Honor, 2 Officer, and Transporters, randomly select three personnel to be killed.

Name: Your Moment is Fading
Text: Randomly select a personnel. Unless that personnel has an attribute>6, he or she is stopped. If that personnel also has an attribute<5, he or she is killed instead of being stopped.

Name: Temporal Misalignment
Text: Randomly select X personnel to be stopped.

Name: The Clown: Bitter Medicine
Text: Place this dilemma on this mission. Your opponent names a skill. Each of your personnel who has that skill is attributes-2. At the end of this turn, this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Tragic Turn
Text: Place this dilemma on this mission (limit one per mission). When a dilemma is overcome here, if that dilemma killed any of your personnel, randomly select a personnel attempting the mission to be killed. Otherwise, if that dilemma stopped any of your personnel, randomly select a personnel attempting the mission to be stopped.

Name: Aftermath
Text: Randomly select three personnel. If the total cost of those personnel is 4 or less, they are killed. Otherwise, randomly select one of those personnel to be stopped.

Name: Dignitaries and Witnesses
Text: Unless you have an Admiral or a General or 3 Leadership, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Eye to Eye
Text: Your opponent names a number. Randomly select two personnel. Each of those personnel that has an attribute matching that number is stopped.

Name: Final Adventure
Text: Your opponent names a number. For each of your headquarters missions, randomly select a personnel who has a cost equal to that number to be killed and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Full Security Alert
Text: Randomly select a Security personnel to be stopped. If that personnel costs 2 or less, randomly select two other Security personnel to be stopped.

Name: Hard Time
Text: Place this dilemma in your core. Randomly select a personnel and place him or her on this dilemma. At the start of your next turn, remove this dilemma from the game and return the personnel on it to his or her owner's hand.

Name: Helpless
Text: Randomly select a personnel. Unless he or she has at least one skill listed in this mission requirements, stop that personnel, then randomly select another personnel to be stopped.

Name: Mr. Tricorder
Text: Your opponent chooses a personnel. Unless you choose to place him or her aboard your ship at this mission, randomly select two personnel to be stopped.

Name: Shipboard Fire
Text: Unless there are no damage markers on this ship, all your personnel are stopped.

Name: The Three Vipers
Text: Unless you have Engineer and 2 Navigation or Astrometrics, Officer, and Science, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma is placed on your ship. Damage - At the start of each of your turns, discard a card from hand.

Name: Unknown Microorganism
Text: Unless you have Biology, Medical, and Science or 2 Security and a non-Hand Weapon equipment, randomly select a personnel to be killed, all of your other personnel are stopped, and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Urgency
Text: Place this dilemma on this mission. Each personnel may use no more than one skill during each dilemma he or she faces. Each personnel may use no more than one skill to meet a mission's requirements. At the end of this turn, this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Worn-Out Welcome
Text: Randomly select a personnel to be stopped. Unless you have Anthropology and 2 Diplomacy or Transporters and 3 Treachery, place that personnel on one of your headquarters missions.

Name: Bynars' Password
Text: Unless you have a personnel who has 2 Engineer or a personnel who has 2 Programming, your opponent chooses an Engineer or Programming personnel to be stopped. If your opponent cannot, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Captain's Holiday
Text: Unless you have 2 Archaeology or 2 Geology, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: The Moon's a Window to Heaven
Text: Unless you have a Leadership personnel who has Cunning>6 or Telepathy, randomly select a personnel to be placed in your opponent's brig, then all your other personnel are stopped.

Name: Don't Let It End This Way
Text: Randomly select one of your stopped personnel on this ship to be killed.

Name: B'omar Stipulations
Text: Unless you have Diplomacy and Cunning>30 or Leadership and Strength>30, all of your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Guess Who's Coming to Dinner?
Text: Choose a personnel who has Diplomacy or Integrity>6 to be stopped. If you cannot, randomly select a personnel to be killed.

Name: Where No One Has Gone Before
Text: Unless you have Astrometrics, Navigation, Physics, and Cunning>34 or Exobiology, Leadership, Medical, and Integrity>32, place this dilemma in your core and place your ship on this dilemma. At the end of your next turn, remove this dilemma from the game and place the ship at your headquarters mission.

Name: Coordinated Effort
Text: Unless you have twelve different skills, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Heart to Heart
Text: Randomly select two personnel. If they share one or more of the same skills, both are stopped.

Name: Entanglement
Text: Your opponent may spend three extra in total cost on dilemmas during this mission attempt.

Name: Psych Test
Text: Your opponent chooses two personnel. Randomly select one of those personnel to be stopped.

Name: Code of Honor
Text: Randomly select two personnel. They cannot use their skills while facing this dilemma. Unless you have Anthropology, Diplomacy, and Honor or Law, Security, and Strength>35, all your personnel are stopped.

Name: Meaningless Modifications
Text: Unless you have 3 Engineer and Leadership or a personnel who has Cunning>6, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Molecular Reversion Field
Text: Unless you have two personnel who each have Integrity>5, Cunning>5, and Strength>5, or have two personnel who have total attributes>38, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma is placed on your ship. Damage - You have 1 fewer counters to spend during each of your Play and Draw Cards segments.

Name: Outmatched
Text: For each dilemma your opponent consumes with this dilemma, add 10 Cunning to this dilemma's requirements. Unless you have Cunning>15, all your personnel are stopped.

Name: Small Problems
Text: Randomly select three personnel. Each of those who is a [Cmd] personnel is stopped.

Name: Quarrel
Text: Randomly select two personnel. Unless they have Integrity>11 or Cunning>11, both are stopped.

Name: Charged-Particle Precipitation
Text: The personnel who has the fewest [SD] icons is stopped. If that personnel does not have at least four [SD] icons, he or she is killed instead.

Name: Financial Pitfall
Text: Unless you have 3 Acquisition or Cunning>35, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Proximity-Actuated Field
Text: Unless you have Biology and 2 Security or 2 Physics and Cunning>35, randomly select a personnel to be stopped and your opponent may move up to two dilemmas from beneath one of your missions to another of your non-headquarters missions.

Name: Stay Where Thou Art
Text: Unless you have Cunning>40 or a personnel who has both Diplomacy and Integrity>7, randomly select three personnel. They cannot use their skills during this mission attempt.

Name: Agonizing Encounter
Text: For each headquarters you command, this dilemma is cost -1. Your opponent names a skill. For each of your missions that requires that skill, randomly select a personnel to be stopped.

Name: Assist Rescue Operation
Text: Unless you have Anthropology, Diplomacy, and Leadership or Officer, Treachery, and Strength>26, randomly select a personnel to be stopped, and if the opponent on your left commands {Earth}, he or she may download a [Fed] ship and its Commander that he or she does not command. If he or she does this, that ship and personnel are then placed at a mission where your opponent could play them.

Name: Between Duty and Respect
Text: Unless you have Archaeology, Geology, and Science or Honor, Leadership, and Officer, randomly select a personnel to be stopped, and if the opponent on your left commands {Bajor}, he or she may take a card from his or her discard pile into hand.

Name: Bre'Nan Ritual
Text: Place this dilemma on this mission. At the start of each mission attempt at this mission, randomly select a personnel to be stopped. When this mission is completed, place this dilemma beneath your incomplete non-headquarters mission.

Name: Cardassian Processing
Text: Unless you have Diplomacy, Honor, and Transporters or Law, Security, and Strength>30, randomly select a personnel to be stopped, and if the opponent on your left commands {Cardassia Prime}, that personnel is placed in your opponent's brig instead.

Name: Chula: Move Along Home
Text: Randomly select three personnel. If the highest Strength among those personnel is even, all three of them are stopped.

Name: Covert Insertion
Text: Unless you have Diplomacy, Officer, and Security or Biology, Intelligence, and Treachery, randomly select a personnel to be stopped, and if the opponent on your left commands {Founders' Homeworld}, he or she may download an Infiltrator that he or she does not command and place him or her on your ship or planet mission.

Name: Cultural Differences
Text: Choose a personnel who has Acquisition or Anthropology to be stopped. If you cannot, randomly select a personnel to be killed.

Name: Dangerous Standoff
Text: Unless you have Diplomacy, Leadership, and Physics or Exobiology, Medical, and Cunning>28, randomly select a personnel to be stopped, and if the opponent on your left commands {Unicomplex} and does not command that personnel, he or she may place that personnel there. Your opponent now commands that personnel.

Name: Deuterium Plunderers
Text: Unless you have Exobiology and 2 Medical or Officer, Security, and Treachery, randomly select a personnel to be stopped, and if the opponent on your left command {Qo'noS}, he or she may download up to three [Kli] personnel that he or she does not command and place them at this mission.

Name: Molecular Mishap
Text: Unless you have Anthropology, Biology, and Cunning>28 or Law, Officer, and Strength>32, lose 5 points.

Name: Opportunity for Profit
Text: Unless you have Acquisition, Engineer, and Programming or Honor, Officer, and Security, randomly select a personnel to be stopped, and the opponent on your left may discard a card from beneath his or her {Ferenginar} to randomly select an additional personnel to be stopped.

Name: Outclassed
Text: Unless you have unused Range>8 or Weapons>8 all your personnel are stopped.

Name: Parallels
Text: Reveal a number of cards from the top of your deck equal to the number of events the opponent to your left has in his or her core. If any of the revealed cards are a copy of a personnel attempting this mission, stop each of those personnel. Place the revealed cards on the bottom of their owner's deck in any order.

Name: Profitable Venture
Text: Unless you have Acquisition, Diplomacy, and Transporters or Law, Officer, and Security, randomly select a personnel to be stopped and the next dilemma revealed during this mission attempt is cost -3.

Name: Tactical Disadvantage
Text: Reveal your hand and the hand of the opponent on your left. If your opponent reveals ships with more total Weapons than the total Shields of ships that you have revealed in this way, randomly select one of your personnel to be killed and all your personnel are stopped.

Name: Telepathic Invasion
Text: Unless you have Diplomacy, Officer, and Telepathy or Intelligence, Treachery, and Cunning>22, randomly select a personnel to be stopped, and if the opponent on your left commands {Romulus}, he or she may examine your hand and discard a card of his or her choice from the revealed cards.

Name: Up the Ante
Text: You may end this mission attempt to prevent and overcome this dilemma (all your personnel are stopped). If you do not and you complete this mission this turn, you win the game. If you do not and do not complete this mission this turn, you lose the game.

Name: Warp Bubble Mishap
Text: Choose a personnel who has Physics or Science to be stopped. If you cannot, randomly select a personnel to be killed.

Name: Zero Hour
Text: Place this dilemma on this mission. Add 3 to each attribute requirement needed to complete this mission for each event in your core. At the end of this turn, this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Revelry
Text: For each of your headquarters missions, randomly select a personnel to be stopped. You may place two personnel from hand in your discard pile to prevent this.

Name: Maquis Vendetta
Text: Randomly select a personnel to be stopped. If that personnel has Officer or Security, randomly select an additional personnel to be stopped.

Name: Shields Up!
Text: Randomly select a personnel to be stopped. If that personnel has Astrometrics or Navigation, randomly select an additional personnel to be stopped.

Name: An Issue of Trust
Text: Unless you have Honor or Treachery, all your personnel are stopped. If you have two or more personnel who have Honor or Treachery, randomly select all but one of those personnel to be stopped.

Name: Not Quite Domesticated Pets
Text: Unless you have Diplomacy, 2 Leadership and Integrity>28 or Biology, 2 Exobiology and Cunning>34, randomly select a personnel to be stopped. If your opponent has more events in his or her core than you and he or she does not command that personnel, place that personnel at his or her headquarters mission instead and that opponent now commands that personnel.

Name: Bio-neural Computer Core
Text: Randomly select a personnel to be stopped. If your opponent does not command that personnel and you still have nine personnel remaining, place him or her on your opponent's headquarters mission instead, then randomly select a second personnel that your opponent does not command to be placed on that opponent's headquarters mission. That opponent now commands those personnel.

Name: Necessary Execution
Text: Your opponent chooses a personnel to be killed. If you do not command a completed space mission, he or she chooses an additional personnel to be killed.

Name: Unbelievable Emergency
Text: Your opponent names a skill. For each headquarters mission you command, randomly select two personnel to be stopped. If either of those personnel that is selected has the named skill, kill that personnel instead.

Name: Nose to Nose
Text: Randomly select two personnel. If they both have the same cost, they are both stopped.

Name: Imagined Emergency
Text: Unless you have Engineer, Exobiology, and Medical or Leadership, Security, and Strength>30, randomly select a personnel to be stopped and your opponent may move up to two dilemmas from beneath one of your missions to another of your non-headquarters missions.

Name: Contaminating a Culture
Text: Randomly select a personnel to be killed. You may prevent this by placing one of your equipment cards present in its owner's discard pile.

Name: A Pattern of Lies
Text: Randomly select three personnel. Unless at least one of them is a different species than the others, all three are stopped. Otherwise, choose one of those personnel to be stopped.

Name: Chameloid Chicanery
Text: Randomly select a personnel to be stopped. If your opponent has an Infiltrator at this mission, randomly select a personnel to be killed.

Name: Thermokinetic Explosion
Text: Unless you have Astrometrics, Navigation, and Cunning>30 or total ship's attributes>21, place this dilemma on your ship and all your personnel are stopped. Damage - At the start of each of your turns, choose an opponent. That opponent may download a Damage card and place it on this ship.

Name: Compassionate Interference
Text: Randomly select a personnel to be stopped. Unless you reveal a Biology personnel from your hand or reveal a Geology personnel from your hand, that personnel is killed instead.

Name: Hull Breach
Text: Randomly select a personnel to be stopped. Unless you reveal an Astrometrics personnel from your hand or reveal a Navigation personnel from your hand, that personnel is killed instead.

Name: Last Gasp
Text: Randomly select a personnel to be stopped. Unless you reveal a Leadership personnel from your hand or reveal an Officer personnel from your hand, that personnel is killed instead.

Name: Armed Search Party
Text: Randomly select three personnel. Unless they have Strength>17 or you have a non-Hand Weapon equipment, for each headquarters mission you command, randomly select one of those personnel to be placed in your opponent's brig.

Name: Difficult Rescue
Text: Unless you have Shields + remaining Range>the number of personnel attempting this mission, randomly select a personnel to be killed and all your other personnel are stopped.

Name: Psionic Attack
Text: Unless you have Medical and Science or 3 Security, randomly select a personnel to place on the bottom of his or her owner's deck. If that personnel has Anthropology, randomly select an additional personnel and place that personnel on the bottom of his or her owner's deck.

Name: Sabotaged Reactor
Text: Unless you have Astrometrics, Engineer, and Navigation or Leadership, Officer, and Cunning>28, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma is placed on your ship. Damage - This ship is Range -2.

Name: Joint Operation Drills
Text: Your opponent names a skill. For each headquarters mission you command, randomly select a person who has that skill to be stopped.

Name: Stand-Off
Text: Unless you have Anthropology, Diplomacy, and Honor or Law, Security, and Strength>28, randomly select a Leadership personnel, place him or her in your opponent's brig, and all your other personnel are stopped.

Name: Symbalene Blood Burn
Text: Unless you have Biology, Exobiology, and Medical or Officer, Security, and Strength>28, randomly select four personnel to be stopped and place this dilemma on your ship at this mission. Damage - At the start of each turn, randomly select a personnel on this ship to be killed.

Name: Temporal Conduit
Text: Unless you have 2 Diplomacy and Leadership or Programming, Science, and Transporters, your opponent places this dilemma on one of your completed missions. At the end of each of your turns, your opponent may place a dilemma from beneath one of your other missions beneath this mission.

Name: Under Pressure
Text: Unless you have Astrometrics, Engineer, and Navigation or Biology, Medical, and Science, randomly select a personnel to be killed. You may randomly select two personnel to be stopped to prevent this.

Name: Accelerated Aging
Text: Place this dilemma on this mission. Each personnel at this mission cannot use their first-listed skill. At the end of this mission attempt, this dilemma is overcome.

Name: Destined Journey
Text: Choose a personnel who has Honor or Leadership to be stopped. If that personnel has both Honor and Leadership, you may unstop your stopped personnel present and that personnel joins the mission attempt. If you cannot choose a personnel with Honor or Leadership, all your personnel are stopped.

Name: Final Triumph
Text: Unless you choose to discard an event from your hand, your opponent chooses a personnel to be stopped.

Name: Subterranean Barrier
Text: Unless you have Biology, Exobiology, Geology and Integrity>25 or Diplomacy, Leadership, Officer and Cunning>32, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: The Caretaker's "Guests"
Text: Your opponent chooses a personnel. You may replace him or her with any one personnel of the same affiliation from your discard pile. Place the personnel your opponent chose on the top of his or her owner's deck.

Name: Psychokinetic Control
Text: Place this dilemma on this mission. Each personnel at this mission loses each skill he or she has gained. Each personnel cannot gain skills. Each personnel cannot increase his or her attributes. At the end of this mission attempt, this dilemma is overcome.

Name: Barrier's Effect
Text: Choose a unique personnel to be attributes +3 until the end of this mission attempt. At the end of this mission attempt, place that personnel and an event in your core in their owner's discard piles.

Name: Mark of Gideon
Text: Randomly select a personnel to be stopped. If you still have nine personnel remaining, return that personnel to his or her owner's hand, then your opponent chooses a second personnel to return to his or her owner's hand. If you still have ten personnel remaining, your opponent chooses a third personnel to return to his or her owner's hand.

Name: Mugato
Text: Unless you have 2 Biology and 2 Medical or Leadership, 2 Security and Strength>34, randomly select two personnel to be stopped and place this dilemma in your core. At the start of each of your turns, discard the top card of your deck.

Name: No Kill I
Text: All your personnel are stopped.

Name: Moment of Doubt
Text: This dilemma is cost -2 for each headquarters mission you command. Your opponent chooses an Officer or Security personnel to be stopped.

Name: Excalbian Drama
Text: When your opponent reveals this dilemma, he or she may discard any number of cards from hand. For each card discarded this way, add 5 Integrity to this dilemma's requirements. Unless you have Integrity>30, all your personnel are stopped.

Name: Fesarius Bluff
Text: When your opponent reveals this dilemma, he or she may discard any number of cards from hand. For each card discarded this way, add 5 Cunning to this dilemma's requirements. Unless you have Cunning>30, all your personnel are stopped.

Name: Silent Attack
Text: Randomly select three personnel. If the total cost of those personnel is 4 or less, they are stopped and this dilemma is placed in your core. Otherwise, randomly select one of those personnel to be stopped. When you play a non-unique personnel, he or she is cost +1.

Name: Arena
Text: Randomly select a personnel. Unless that personnel has total attributes>18, your opponent places him or her on a planet mission.

Name: Distress Call
Text: This dilemma is cost -3 for each mission you have completed. All your personnel are stopped.

Name: Neural Parasites
Text: This dilemma is cost +3 for each mission you have completed. For each headquarters mission you command, your opponent chooses a personnel to be killed.

Name: Vian Test
Text: Choose a personnel to place in your opponent's brig. If that personnel is non-unique, your opponent draws up to three cards.

Name: Casualties
Text: The personnel who has the fewest [SD] icons is stopped. If that personnel does not have at least four [SD] icons, he or she is killed instead.

Name: Swashbuckler at Heart
Text: Reveal your hand and place each interrupt revealed this way on top of your deck in any order. Your opponent draws up to two cards.

Name: Vault of Tomorrow
Text: Your opponent searches his or her dilemma pile and chooses a dilemma that has a cost of 2 or less to place on top of his or her dilemma stack. Then your opponent shuffles his or her dilemma pile and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Gangster's Welcome
Text: Unless you have Law and 2 Leadership or 2 Officer and 2 Security, randomly select a personnel to be killed and your opponent may destroy up to two events in your core.

Name: Gorgan
Text: Your opponent discards a card from his or her hand. Unless you discard a card from hand that has an equal or greater cost than that card, all your personnel are stopped.

Name: Lawgivers
Text: For each headquarters mission you command, your opponent chooses a personnel to be stopped. Each [NA] personnel stopped this way is returned to his or her owner's hand.

Name: Trelane's Trial
Text: Choose a personnel that does not have an attributes>6 to be stopped. If you cannot, for each headquarters mission you command, randomly select a personnel to be killed.

Name: Interphasic Effects
Text: Unless you have an [AU] personnel, randomly select a personnel to be killed and your opponent may choose an event to destroy.

Name: Paranoid Escape
Text: Place this dilemma on this mission. Randomly select a personnel to be removed from the game. You cannot play cards that have the same title as that personnel. When you complete this mission, put the personnel removed from the game in his or her owner's hand and this dilemma is overcome.

Name: Chula: The Dice
Text: Unless you have a personnel with Integrity>6, a second personnel with Cunning>6, and a third personnel with Strength>6, all your personnel are stopped.

Name: Crew Advancement
Text: Your opponent names an attributes (Integrity, Cunning, or Strength). Your personnel with the highest named attribute is stopped.

Name: Fractured Time
Text: Randomly select nine personnel. All your other personnel are removed from the game.

Name: Aftereffects
Text: Randomly select three personnel. If the total cost of those personnel is 5 or less, they are killed. Otherwise, randomly select one of those personnel to be stopped.

Name: Preventative Repercussions
Text: Randomly select three personnel. If the total cost of those personnel is 5 or less, they are killed. Otherwise, randomly select one of those personnel to be stopped.

Name: Dangerous Missions
Text: Place this dilemma on this mission. Each personnel who has a cost of 2 or less cannot use his or her skills while facing dilemmas. At the end of this turn, this dilemma is overcome.

Name: Distraction
Text: Choose a number of personnel who have a total cost of 4 or more to be stopped.

Name: Infestation
Text: Your opponent may have more than three copies of this card in his or her dilemma pile. Your personnel can face more than one copy of this dilemma during each mission attempt. Choose a personnel to be stopped.

Name: Stripped Down *AP
Text: Your opponent moves up to two dilemmas from beneath this mission to another of your non-headquarters missions.

Name: Disarming Dream
Text: Your opponent names a species. Randomly select a personnel of that species to be stopped.

Name: Reflections
Text: Reveal a number of cards from the top of your deck equal to the number of [AU] cards your opponent commands. For each event or interrupt revealed, your opponent chooses a personnel to be stopped.

Name: Alien Conspiracy
Text: Choose three personnel. Your opponent chooses one of those personnel to be stopped.

Name: Captured by the Breen
Text: Randomly select three personnel. If the total cost of those personnel is 4 or less, they are placed in your opponent's brig. Otherwise, randomly select one of those personnel to be stopped.

Name: The Dal'Rok
Text: Unless your personnel have a total cost>17, for each headquarters mission you command, randomly select a personnel to be killed and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Key to the Alpha Quadrant
Text: Unless you have Astrometrics, Diplomacy, and Officer or Leadership, Security, and Treachery, randomly select a personnel to be stopped, and if the opponent on your left commands Mouth of the Wormhole, he or she scores 5 points.

Name: New Advancements
Text: Unless you have Diplomacy, Leadership, and Navigation or a ship at a completed space mission, randomly select a personnel to be stopped, and if the opponent on your left commands {Earth}, he or she may download two [SF] cards.

Name: Shattered
Text: Unless you have Anthropology, Leadership, and Science or Engineer, Transporters, and Cunning>28, randomly select a personnel to be stopped, and if the opponent on your left does not command a headquarters mission, he or she may take a [Voy] personnel from his or her discard pile and place him or her aboard a ship at a [DQ] mission.

Name: The Secret War
Text: Unless you have Honor, Officer, and Integrity>34, or Security, Treachery, and Strength>34, randomly select a personnel to be stopped, and if the opponent on your left commands {Athos IV}, that personnel is returned to his or her owner's hand instead.

Name: Paradan Replicant
Text: Randomly select a personnel to be stopped. If that personnel is non-unique, remove all copies of that personnel in hand from the game, search your deck for any additional copies of that personnel, remove them from the game as well, and shuffle and replace your deck.

Name: Security Weapons
Text: Randomly select a personnel to be stopped. If that personnel has a cost of 2 or less, kill him or her instead.

Name: Prisoner of the Exile
Text: Choose a personnel to be placed in your opponent's brig.

Name: Moral Choice
Text: Randomly select three personnel. If any of those personnel is a [Fed] personnel, they are all stopped. Otherwise, choose one of those personnel to be stopped.

Name: Shocking Betrayal
Text: Choose a personnel to be stopped and your opponent may discard a non-[NA] personnel from hand to choose a personnel that is the same affiliation as that discarded personnel to be killed.

Name: Spatial Distortions
Text: Choose a personnel to be placed in your discard pile.

Name: Toe to Toe
Text: Randomly select a personnel. Unless you stop that personnel and another personnel with the same cost, he or she is killed.

Name: Neurogenic Field
Text: Choose a personnel who has Anthropology or Medical to be stopped. If you cannot, randomly select a personnel to be killed.

Name: Night Terrors
Text: Choose a personnel who has Medical or Science to be stopped. If you cannot, randomly select a personnel to be killed.

Name: Cargo Pirates
Text: Randomly select a personnel to be stopped and if your opponent commands three Thief personnel, choose an additional personnel to be stopped.

Name: Inferiority
Text: Place this dilemma in your core. When your personnel begin a mission attempt, your opponent may remove this dilemma from the game to draw three extra dilemmas and spend three extra in total cost on dilemmas.

Name: Prefix Codes
Text: Place this dilemma on this mission. At the end of this mission attempt, if there are no damage markers on any of your ships at this mission, choose one of those ships and place this dilemma on it. Otherwise, overcome this dilemma. Damage - This ship is Shields -10.

Name: Back to Basics
Text: Your opponent counts each personnel and ship card in his or her discard pile and shuffles each of those cards into his or her deck. If fourteen or more cards were shuffled into his or her deck this way, all your personnel are stopped.

Name: Juxtaposition
Text: Your opponent may return up to two Persistent dilemmas he or she owns from beneath one of your completed missions to his or her dilemma pile and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Caretaker's Wave
Text: Unless you have Astrometrics and Engineer or 3 Navigation, stop all of your personnel and this dilemma is placed on your ship. Damage - At the start of each of your turns, the owner of this dilemma may place this ship at your mission.

Name: Old Differences
Text: When you reveal this dilemma from the dilemma stack, if this mission is worth 35 or less points, it is cost -1. Randomly select two personnel to be stopped.

Name: Sylvia
Text: For each event your opponent commands in his or her core, this dilemma is cost -1 (-2 for each Decay event). Unless you have 2 Leadership, Officer, Security, and Cunning>38 or 2 Engineer, Programming, and 2 Science, randomly select two personnel to be placed in your opponent's brig.

Name: Chula: The Chandra
Text: Randomly select a personnel. Repeat this until you select a personnel with a cost equal to or greater than the first personnel that you selected. Stop each selected personnel.

Name: The Phage
Text: Choose a personnel to be placed in your discard pile.

Name: The Clown: Guillotine
Text: Your opponent names a skill. Randomly select a personnel with that skill. Unless that personnel has an attribute>6, randomly select a second personnel with that skill. Each selected personnel is killed and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Stripped Down
Text: Your opponent moves up to two dilemmas from beneath this mission to another of your non-headquarters missions.

Name: Harsh Conditions (Promo)
Text: For each headquarters mission you command, your opponent names a skill. Place this dilemma on this mission. While your personnel is facing a dilemma, he or she cannot use those skills. At the end of this mission attempt, this dilemma is overcome.

Name: Timescape (Promo)
Text: Place this dilemma on this mission. You cannot begin a mission attempt at this mission. At the end of this turn, this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Agonizing Encounter (Promo)
Text: For each headquarters you command, this dilemma is cost -1. Your opponent names a skill. For each of your missions that requires that skill, randomly select a personnel to be stopped.

Name: Guess Who's Coming to Dinner? (Promo)
Text: Choose a personnel who has Diplomacy or Integrity>6 to be stopped. If you cannot, randomly select a personnel to be killed.

Name: Tragic Turn (Promo)
Text: Place this dilemma on this mission (limit one per mission). When a dilemma is overcome here, if that dilemma killed any of your personnel, randomly select a personnel attempting the mission to be killed. Otherwise, if that dilemma stopped any of your personnel, randomly select a personnel attempting the mission to be stopped.

Name: No Kill I (Promo)
Text: All your personnel are stopped.

Name: Chula: The Dice (Promo)
Text: Unless you have a personnel with Integrity>6, a second personnel with Cunning>6, and a third personnel with Strength>6, all your personnel are stopped.

Name: Agonizing Encounter *(Promo)
Text: For each headquarters you command, this dilemma is cost -1. Your opponent names a skill. For each of your missions that requires that skill, randomly select a personnel to be stopped.

Name: Tragic Turn *(Promo)
Text: Place this dilemma on this mission (limit one per mission). When a dilemma is overcome here, if that dilemma killed any of your personnel, randomly select a personnel attempting the mission to be killed. Otherwise, if that dilemma stopped any of your personnel, randomly select a personnel attempting the mission to be stopped.

Name: Skeleton Crew (Promo)
Text: Place this dilemma on this mission. To begin a mission attempt at this mission, you must have at least six personnel involved. When you complete this mission, this dilemma is overcome.

Name: Assassination Attempt (AC)
Text: Randomly select two personnel. Each of those personnel who does not have Treachery is killed.

Name: Nanite Attack (AC)
Text: Unless you have 2 Diplomacy and 2 Engineer or 2 Security and a Hand Weapon, this dilemma is placed on your ship. Damage - At the end of each of your turns, randomly select a personnel aboard this ship to be killed.

Name: Tsiolkovsky Infection
Text: For each event your opponent commands in his or her core, this dilemma is cost -1. Unless you have 2 Anthropology, 2 Programming, and Cunning>38 or 2 Biology, Exobiology, and 2 Medical, randomly select three personnel to be killed.

Name: Whisper in the Dark
Text: For each event your opponent commands in his or her core, this dilemma is cost -1. Unless you have 2 Geology, 2 Physics, and Cunning>38 or 2 Honor, 2 Officer, and Transporters, randomly select three personnel to be killed.

Name: Kelvan Show of Force (R2)
Text: Your opponent chooses two personnel (except an Android or a Hologram). Randomly select one of those personnel to be killed.

Name: Maglock (R2)
Text: Unless you have 3 Officer or 3 Programming, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Personal Duty (R2)
Text: Unless you have Leadership or Officer, all your personnel are stopped. If you have two or more personnel who have Leadership or Officer, randomly select all but one of those personnel to be stopped.

Name: Face to Face (R2)
Text: Your opponent names a skill. Randomly select two personnel. Each of those personnel that has that skill is killed.

Name: Head to Head (R2)
Text: Your opponent names a skill. Randomly select two personnel. Each of those personnel that has that skill is killed.

Name: Gomtuu Shock Wave (R2)
Text: Unless you have 2 Diplomacy and Integrity>32 or Telepathy and Integrity>35, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma is placed on your ship. Damage - This ship is attributes-2.

Name: Overwhelmed (R2)
Text: Place this dilemma on this mission. When a personnel facing a dilemma at this mission uses his or her skills, he or she is stopped. At the end of this turn, return this dilemma to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Biochemical Hyperacceleration (R2)
Text: Randomly select three personnel. They cannot use their skills while facing this dilemma. Unless you have Biology, Geology, and Medical or 2 Security and Strength>38, those personnel are returned to their owner's hand.

Name: Broken Captive (R2)
Text: Your opponent chooses one of his or her captives. Unless you have the skills on that captive, all your personnel are stopped.

Name: Counterinsurgency Program (R2)
Text: Your opponent discards any number of event or equipment cards from hand and names a skill (except Acquisition, Intelligence, Law or Telepathy) for each one. Unless you have those skills, all your personnel are stopped.

Name: In Training (R2)
Text: Randomly select a personnel who costs 1 or 2. All other personnel who cost 1 or 2 are stopped.

Name: Talosian Trial (R2)
Text: Your opponent takes one of his or her planet dilemmas that is overcome beneath one of your missions and places it face down on top of his or her stack of chosen dilemmas.

Name: The Dreamer and the Dream (R2)
Text: Place this dilemma on this mission. At the end of this turn, this dilemma is overcome. If at that time this mission has not been completed, its owner discards his or her hand.

Name: Tsiolkovsky Infection (R2)
Text: For each event your opponent commands in his or her core, this dilemma is cost -1. Unless you have 2 Anthropology, 2 Programming, and Cunning>38 or 2 Biology, Exobiology, and 2 Medical, randomly select three personnel to be killed.

Name: Whisper in the Dark (R2)
Text: For each event your opponent commands in his or her core, this dilemma is cost -1. Unless you have 2 Geology, 2 Physics, and Cunning>38 or 2 Honor, 2 Officer, and Transporters, randomly select three personnel to be killed.

Name: Code of Honor *A
Text: Randomly select two personnel. They cannot use their skills while facing this dilemma. Unless you have Anthropology, Diplomacy, and Honor or Law, Security, and Strength>35, all your personnel are stopped.

Name: Proximity-Actuated Field *A
Text: Unless you have Biology and 2 Security or 2 Physics and Cunning>35, randomly select a personnel to be stopped and your opponent may move up to two dilemmas from beneath one of your missions to another of your non-headquarters missions.

Name: Where No One Has Gone Before *A
Text: Unless you have Astrometrics, Navigation, Physics, and Cunning>34 or Exobiology, Leadership, Medical, and Integrity>32, place this dilemma in your core and place your ship on this dilemma. At the end of your next turn, remove this dilemma from the game and place the ship at your headquarters mission.

Name: Cardassian Processing *A
Text: Unless you have Diplomacy, Honor, and Transporters or Law, Security, and Strength>30, randomly select a personnel to be stopped, and if the opponent on your left commands {Cardassia Prime}, that personnel is placed in your opponent's brig instead.

Name: Outclassed *A
Text: Unless you have unused Range>8 or Weapons>8 all your personnel are stopped.

Name: Zero Hour *A
Text: Place this dilemma on this mission. Add 3 to each attribute requirement needed to complete this mission for each event in your core. At the end of this turn, this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: An Issue of Trust *A
Text: Unless you have Honor or Treachery, all your personnel are stopped. If you have two or more personnel who have Honor or Treachery, randomly select all but one of those personnel to be stopped.

Name: Armed Search Party *A
Text: Randomly select three personnel. Unless they have Strength>17 or you have a non-Hand Weapon equipment, for each headquarters mission you command, randomly select one of those personnel to be placed in your opponent's brig.

Name: Thermokinetic Explosion *A
Text: Unless you have Astrometrics, Navigation, and Cunning>30 or total ship's attributes>21, place this dilemma on your ship and all your personnel are stopped. Damage - At the start of each of your turns, choose an opponent. That opponent may download a Damage card and place it on this ship.

Name: No Kill I *A
Text: All your personnel are stopped.

Name: Psychokinetic Control *A
Text: Place this dilemma on this mission. Each personnel at this mission loses each skill he or she has gained. Each personnel cannot gain skills. Each personnel cannot increase his or her attributes. At the end of this mission attempt, this dilemma is overcome.

Name: Swashbuckler at Heart *A
Text: Reveal your hand and place each interrupt revealed this way on top of your deck in any order. Your opponent draws up to two cards.

Name: Vian Test *A
Text: Choose a personnel to place in your opponent's brig. If that personnel is non-unique, your opponent draws up to three cards.

Name: Chula: The Dice *A
Text: Unless you have a personnel with Integrity>6, a second personnel with Cunning>6, and a third personnel with Strength>6, all your personnel are stopped.

Name: Paranoid Escape *A
Text: Place this dilemma on this mission. Randomly select a personnel to be removed from the game. You cannot play cards that have the same title as that personnel. When you complete this mission, put the personnel removed from the game in his or her owner's hand and this dilemma is overcome.

Name: The Dal'Rok *A
Text: Unless your personnel have a total cost>17, for each headquarters mission you command, randomly select a personnel to be killed and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: The Clown: Guillotine *A
Text: Your opponent names a skill. Randomly select a personnel with that skill. Unless that personnel has an attribute>6, randomly select a second personnel with that skill. Each selected personnel is killed and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Accelerated Aging
Text: Place this dilemma on this mission. Each personnel at this mission cannot use their first-listed skill. At the end of this mission attempt, this dilemma is overcome.

Name: Destined Journey
Text: Choose a personnel who has Honor or Leadership to be stopped. If that personnel has both Honor and Leadership, you may unstop your stopped personnel present and that personnel joins the mission attempt. If you cannot choose a personnel with Honor or Leadership, all your personnel are stopped.

Name: Final Triumph
Text: Unless you choose to discard an event from your hand, your opponent chooses a personnel to be stopped.

Name: Not Quite Domesticated Pets
Text: Unless you have Diplomacy, 2 Leadership and Integrity>28 or Biology, 2 Exobiology and Cunning>34, randomly select a personnel to be stopped. If your opponent has more events in his or her core than you and he or she does not command that personnel, place that personnel at his or her headquarters mission instead and that opponent now commands that personnel.

Name: Subterranean Barrier
Text: Unless you have Biology, Exobiology, Geology and Integrity>25 or Diplomacy, Leadership, Officer and Cunning>32, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: The Caretaker's "Guests"
Text: Your opponent chooses a personnel. You may replace him or her with any one personnel of the same affiliation from your discard pile. Place the personnel your opponent chose on the top of his or her owner's deck.

Name: Unbelievable Emergency
Text: Your opponent names a skill. For each headquarters mission you command, randomly select two personnel to be stopped. If either of those personnel that is selected has the named skill, kill that personnel instead.

Name: Authenticate Artifacts (SR)
Text: Unless you have a personnel who has 2 Anthropology or a personnel who has 2 Archaeology, your opponent chooses an Anthropology or Archaeology personnel to be stopped. If your opponent cannot, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Command Decisions (SR)
Text: Choose a personnel who has Leadership or Officer to be stopped. If you cannot, randomly select a personnel to be killed.

Name: Kolaran Raiders (SR)
Text: Choose a personnel who has Leadership or Security to be stopped. If you cannot, randomly select a personnel to be killed.

Name: Limited Welcome (SR)
Text: Randomly select nine personnel. All your other personnel are stopped. Place this dilemma on this mission. When you attempt this mission again, after your opponent draws dilemmas, he or she may take this dilemma and add it to those drawn.

Name: Ornaran Threat (SR)
Text: Randomly select a personnel to be stopped. Unless you have Diplomacy and Medical or 2 Security, that personnel is killed instead, then all your other personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Pinned Down (SR)
Text: Randomly select a personnel to be stopped. If you still have nine personnel remaining, randomly select a second personnel to be stopped. If you still have ten personnel remaining, randomly select a third personnel to be stopped.

Name: Systems Diagnostic (SR)
Text: Choose a personnel who has Engineer or Programming to be stopped. If you cannot, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Triage (SR)
Text: Choose a personnel who has Biology or Medical to be stopped. If you cannot, randomly select a personnel to be killed.

Name: Wavefront (SR)
Text: Unless you have a personnel who has 2 Astrometrics or a personnel who has 2 Navigation, your opponent chooses an Astrometrics or Navigation personnel to be stopped. If your opponent cannot, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Instigate Dissension
Text: Randomly select two personnel to be stopped. Unless you command one or less headquarters missions, your opponent places this dilemma on one of your headquarters missions. You cannot play personnel at this mission. At the end of each of your turns, you may reveal three different non-[NA] personnel from hand who could be played at this headquarters to remove this dilemma from the game.

Name: Breaking the Ice
Text: Unless you have 3 Geology or two non-Hand Weapon equipment, all your personnel are stopped.

Name: We'll Never Know
Text: Unless you have 3 Physics or two non-Hand Weapon equipment, all your personnel are stopped.

Name: Once More Unto the Breach
Text: Your opponent chooses a staffed Cloaking Device ship he or she commands at this mission. That ship is Weapons +1 until the end of this dilemma. Unless you have Shields>that ship's Weapons, randomly select a personnel to be killed and all of your personnel are stopped.

Name: The Conscience of the King
Text: Place this dilemma on this mission. Each planet dilemma and space dilemma revealed at this mission is cost -1.

Name: Ferengi Locator Bomb
Text: Unless you have Navigation, Physics, and Programming or Acquisition, Treachery, and Cunning>32, randomly select a personnel to be placed on the bottom of his or her owner's deck and all your personnel are stopped.

Name: What Lies Beneath
Text: Unless you have Archaeology, Geology, and Honor or Anthropology, Treachery, and Cunning>32, randomly select a personnel to be placed on the bottom of his or her owner's deck and all your personnel are stopped.

Name: Predictable Response
Text: Unless you have Anthropology and Diplomacy or 2 Security, all your [Cmd] personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

Name: Curt Reprimand
Text: Randomly select three personnel. If the cost of any of those personnel is 1 or less, all three are stopped. Otherwise, randomly select one of those personnel to be stopped.

Name: Show Trial
Text: Randomly select a personnel who has Leadership or Medical to be stopped. If you have more points than each of your opponents, randomly select an additional personnel to be stopped.

Name: Bold Plan
Text: Your opponent may return up to two dilemmas from beneath any of your non-headquarters missions to their owner's dilemma piles.

Name: Let Them Worry
Text: Unless you have 3 Honor or Medical, Physics, and Strength>28, randomly select a personnel to be stopped, and if your opponent commands 3 Shape-shifter personnel, all your personnel are stopped.

Name: One to One
Text: Randomly select two personnel. If they both are [Cmd] or both are [Stf], they are stopped.

Name: Treachery Running Deep
Text: Unless you have 3 Anthropology or Physics, Treachery, and Cunning>28, randomly select a personnel to be stopped, and discard a card from hand for each Praetor personnel and Senator personnel your opponent commands.

Name: All-Consuming Evil
Text: Place this dilemma on top of its owner's dilemma pile. When this dilemma is placed beneath a mission by a Consume dilemma, your opponent names a skill. Randomly select a personnel that is attempting that mission with that skill to be killed.

Name: Artificial Wormhole
Text: Your personnel cannot gain skills while facing this dilemma. Unless you have 2 Leadership and 2 Officer, or Engineer, Programming, and Cunning>33, or this ship's Commander aboard your opponent may take a ship at a mission and place it at a different mission. That ship's Range for this turn is used.

Name: Best Interests at Heart
Text: Randomly select three personnel. If the total cost of those personnel is 4 or less, lose 5 points and your opponent scores 5 points. Otherwise, randomly select one of those personnel to be stopped.

Name: Skeptical Superiors
Text: Unless you have 3 Leadership or Astrometrics, Programming, and Cunning>28, randomly select a personnel to be stopped, and randomly select a personnel to be stopped for each Admiral personnel your opponent commands.

Name: The Clown: On His Throne
